definition[0]: the percentage of sales in a market that a company or product has
example[0]: The company foresees improvement in profit this year through increasing its share of the California housing market.
example[1]: If the two companies’ market shares are combined, they’ll have 28% of the US market.
example[2]: Our strategy through the year was to maintain market share (=keep it at the same level) and control costs.
example[3]: Faced with declining (=decreasing) market share and falling profits, the firm laid off workers.
